description.narrative: The #Preventing the Spread of the Ebola Virus in Senegal and Guinea-Bissau: Ensuring high-risk border regions are prepared to prevent, promptly detect and control the spread of disease# project is implemented by Oxfam in Senegal and Guinea Bissau along with the following project counterparts: the Associaçao Nacional para o Desenvolvimento Local Urbano (NADEL) in Guinea Bissau, Solidarité Action et Developpement (SADEV) and La Lumiére in Senegal. The project takes place in the Dakar, Tambacounda, Kolda and Kedougou regionsof Senegal and in the Tombali and Bijagos Island Regions of Guinea-Bissau and its main goal is to contribute to reducing the risk of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) outbreak in Senegal and Guinea Bissau by undertaking social mobilization alongside the national governments# efforts. The project intends to target communities along the Senegal and Guinea Bissau borders with Guinea Conakry that are confronted with health, water and sanitation challenges as well as communities in densely populated cities and town. Medical practitioners at community levels and community health workers will also be targeted as key agents of change. Overall this project will reach 30,000 direct beneficiaries and 164,000 indirect beneficiaries with services including: hygiene kit distributions to vulnerable families; social mobilizations; information and education campaigns; trainings of community field workers, women#s groups and health facilities; training families in proper hygiene practices; stocking health facilities with preventive gear; strengthening community disease surveillance capacity; and rehabilitating wells to ensure access to clean water. Oxfam is part of the consortium of INGOs and Government agencies implicated in the Ebola response. We work with the Consortium agencies to map our intervention areas and to avoid duplication of resources and also regularly participate in all Cluster Meetings (WASH and EFSVL) coordinated by OCHA for the EbolaCrisis. Oxfam has been running humanitarian and development programs in these project regions for over 7 years, concentrating primarily on food security, hygiene promotion and disease prevention. In Guinea-Bissau, we currently run a hygiene promotion program targeting cholera in the Tombali region, which we started in 2013, and a chlorine dispenser project in the Bijagos Islands with our partners NADEL and ADEMA. Oxfam will continue to work on well rehabilitation and hygiene promotion in these communities. In Senegal, we currently run: a sustainable flood risk management programme in the slums of Dakar; a WASH initiative in Kolda Region, which is an extension to our response to the 2012 food crisis in the region; a food security program in Kedougou, which includes hygiene and sanitation work; and a community-based microfinance program called Saving for Change as well as a rural resilience project with women groups in Tambacounda and Kolda.

participating-org.narrative: Nadel is a relatively young NGO that emerged from a former SNV project resulting in personnel with good capacities. Since 2001, theyear they started as an NGO, Nadel has been receiving various small finances from different donors, causing until now mostof the personnel working on a voluntary basis. With their local development schemes in Bissau, livelihood program in the Northern Province, Nadel continue to show good capacities as a networker and implementer. As such Nadel collaborates with institutionslike UNICEF, plan International, Oxfam Novib and Oxfam America in various areas including livelihoods, public health, education, etc
